JUDGES: Alvina Gyulumyan;Corneliu Bîrsan;Egbert Myjer;Ineta Ziemele;Josep Casadevall;Luis López Guerra;Mihai Poalelungi
TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and is currently serving a DATE prison sentence in ORG prison for aggravated murder . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , PERSON .

CARDINAL . NORP The applicant submitted numerous complaints to the ORG . Among those was a complaint that he had been denied the right to vote in the general election to the GPE , the NORP parliament , on DATE , as the police had failed to send his passport to the prison where he was being held in custody at the time . He also alleged a violation of LAW , on account of the fact that he had been called a “ murderer ” during a TV broadcast .
CARDINAL . NORP The applicant ’s complaints under LAW No . CARDINAL to LAW were communicated to the Government on DATE , who submitted observations on the admissibility and merits of the case .

CARDINAL . The applicant did not submit any observations . Instead , in his letter of CARDINAL DATE he stated that “ ORG is not afraid of [ the ORG ] , because [ the ORG ] plays with it like a toy ” .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG repeatedly requested him to appoint a representative and advised him to contact ORG if he could not find one himself . The applicant did not designate a lawyer .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant expressed distrust in the ORG and used grossly abusive language towards it . In reply , the ORG notified the applicant that the time - limit for submission of his observations had expired , and drew his attention to LAW ( a ) of the LAW , which provides that the ORG may strike a case out of its list of cases where the circumstances lead to the conclusion that the applicant does not intend to pursue the application .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant informed the ORG that he did not intend to withdraw his application , and requested an extension of time to submit his observations . Exceptionally , the President of the ORG granted that request .

CARDINAL . On DATE , in reply to the ORG ’s letter stating their position on a friendly settlement , the applicant issued threats directed at officials of ORG . The ORG replied to the applicant on CARDINAL DATE , explaining the procedure before it and insisting on the need for the applicant to appoint a representative .

CARDINAL . In the letter sent on CARDINAL DATE the applicant continued to issue abusive and threatening remarks . He stated that “ the ORG supports fascism ” and that during DATE he would “ find the opportunity to discover the truth and [ the chance ] to make sure that those who call themselves gods get what they deserve ” . In reply , the ORG referred to its previous letter .
CARDINAL . In the letter dated CARDINAL DATE the applicant stated that he did not have any trust in the ORG because it scoffed at human rights .
CARDINAL . In his letter of CARDINAL DATE the applicant continued to use grossly abusive language towards the ORG and the ORG .
